oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Determining frequency of common pulmonary gross and histopathological findings in feedyard fatalities
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schmidt, P.
White, B.
Finley, A.
Bortoluzzi, E.
Depenbusch, B.
Mancke, M.
Lancaster, P.
Larson, R.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pulmonary disease is often associated with morbidity and mortality in feedlot cattle. The most common syndromes in足clude bronchopneumonia, acute interstitial pneumonia, and bronchopneumonia with an interstitial pneumonia. Systemic necropsy is a useful diagnostic tool to collect information to enhance decision making about the health and management of feedlot cohorts. The study objective was to utilize gross nec足ropsy and histopathology to determine the frequency of pul足monary lesions associated with 3 major syndromes and the agreement between gross and histopathological diagnoses. Furthermore, we assessed the consistency of classifying his足topathologic lesions from 4 different lung lobe samples taken from an individual case.
